text: Disperis nitida is a species of plants (in the family Orchidaceae) endemic to Cameroon which is found in two locations - Manengouba and in the mountainous region of Bamenda. In decline due to deforestation of its unprotected habitat, it is evaluated as a species in critical danger of extinction.. ==References== ==Bibliography== * Jean-Michel Onana and Martin Cheek, "Disperis nitida Summerh.", in Red Data Book of the Flowering Plants of Cameroon: IUCN Global Assessments, Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, 2011, ==External links== * * * * * * * Category:Coryciinae Category:Endemic flora of Cameroon
title: Disperis nitida
